intro: Vandellia hirta, commonly known as the hairy vandellia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky outcrops. Vandellia hirta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
